pull.title: Showing "not_applicable" if BIP9 timeout is 0
pull.body: getblockchaininfo will show a BIP9 proposal as "not_applicable" (instead of "failed") if the timeout is 0. A timeout before the genesis block timestamp guaruntees that a softfork must not be activated in any circumstances. A timeout of 0 should be used when we want to merge a softfork proposal without defining its deployment schedule

events.body: This new logic seems "out there" to the reader. You may want to document the reasoning for this check.

So when such a softfork is merged in, what is its state (according to BIP9)?
Should we merge in the source code and keep consensus.vDeployments filled in in such cases? Isn't it better to comment it out instead? Or change BIP9 to reflect this new not-yet-DEFINED state?

I think we should just hide deployments whose end time is 0. For all
intents and purposes, the software behaves as if the deployment didn't
exist at all.

issue.title: RPC: Hide softfork if timeout is 0
issue.body:
Replace #8209

getblockchaininfo will not show a BIP9 proposal if the timeout is 0. A timeout before the genesis block timestamp guarantees that a softfork must not be activated in any circumstances. A timeout of 0 should be used when we want to merge a softfork proposal without defining its deployment schedule

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -897,7 +906,7 @@ UniValue getblockchaininfo(const UniValue& params, bool fHelp)
             "  ],\n"
             "  \"bip9_softforks\": {          (object) status of BIP9 softforks in progress\n"
             "     \"xxxx\" : {                (string) name of the softfork\n"
-            "        \"status\": \"xxxx\",    (string) one of \"defined\", \"started\", \"lockedin\", \"active\", \"failed\"\n"
+            "        \"status\": \"xxxx\",    (string) one of \"defined\", \"started\", \"locked_in\", \"active\", \"failed\", \"not_applicable\"\n"
